HEA_composition.atomic_fraction_range_at_percent: 7â€“25 at.% for each element (ICP-MS and XPS)

synthesis.method: one-step solvothermal synthesis followed by thermal annealing
synthesis.post_treatment: thermal annealing to form PtPd-rich surface
synthesis.note: exact precursor chemical formulas, solvent composition, reaction temperature, time, and atmosphere are not explicitly specified in the main text

XRD.feature: diffraction peaks located between Pt and Pd, indicating lattice distortion

STEM_EDS.element_distribution: random but uniform distribution of all seven elements

XPS.surface_enrichment: Pt and Pd surface concentration higher than bulk
XPS.Pt_4f_shift: negative shift (~0.8 eV) relative to Pt/C
XPS.Pd_3d_shift: negative shift (~0.3 eV) relative to Pd/C
XPS.non_PGM_elements: positive binding-energy shifts, slightly oxidized surface
XPS.interpretation: electron transfer from non-PGM elements to Pt/Pd

key_findings.CO_adsorption: weaker on Pt/Pd sites in HEA than on Pt(111) and Pd(111)
key_findings.water_adsorption: Fe, Co, Mn preferentially adsorb H2O and generate OH*
key_findings.ethanol_adsorption: moderate adsorption strength on Pt/Pd sites in HEA
key_findings.mechanistic_conclusion: synergistic multi-element effects enable complete 12e EOR and enhanced ORR
